prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, having the following dimensions: length - 0.75 units, width - 0.75 units, and height - 0.75 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with these properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. **Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane** of the new coordinate system: a. Draw a line (line\\_1) from the point (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.0) on the X axis. b. Draw a line (line\\_2) from the point (0.75, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.75) on the Y axis. c. Draw a line (line\\_3) from the point (0.75, 0.75) to the point (0.0, 0.75) on the Y axis. d. Draw a line (line\\_4) from the point (0.0, 0.75) to the point (0.0, 0.0) on the X axis. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75** using the `sketch_scale` parameter. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D geometry**: a. Set the rotation angles corresponding to the X, Y, Z axes using the Euler angles of the coordinate system. In this case, only rotate around the Z-axis with an angle of -90 degrees. b. Apply the translation vector of the coordinate system, which moves the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D prism model**: a. Extrude along the positive Z-axis by 0.75 units. b. Set the extrusion depth towards the negative Z-axis to 0 units. c. Apply the `NewBodyFeatureOperation` using the `operation` parameter provided in the JSON. The three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom is complete. It has the following faces: - Face 1 (bottom): This face is defined by the loop created by lines: line\\_1 and line\\_4, with four vertices in total, forming a rectangle. - Face 2 (right side): This face is defined by the loop created by lines: line\\_2 and line\\_3, with four vertices in total, forming a rectangle. - Face 3 (top): This face is defined by the loop that results from applying the scaling, rotation, and translation transformations to the original sketch. It is also a rectangle, similar to Face 1, but translated and rotated according to the coordinate system provided. Additionally, this prism has the following edges: - Four vertical edges: corners of the prism, defined by the intersection of all the faces. - Four horizontal edges: top and bottom edges of Face 1 and Face 3. Now, move on to create the next part based on the provided JSON and follow the same structure as outlined above.</description>
